Based on my search results, here's what I found about Fred Fordham's 2018 graphic novel adaptation of "To Kill a Mockingbird":

## Reviews

The graphic novel adaptation received overwhelmingly positive reviews:

The book has 1,305 reviews on Goodreads, indicating significant reader engagement. Reviews consistently praised Fordham's work:

- "Phew, Fordham did an amazing job! Not only were the illustrations great, but the story is faithful to the book and hits all the great scenes. This is one I hope to buy as it a must for any collection, especially fans of the writer and the book."

- The adaptation is really true to the book. Fordham writes that for the most part, he used Lee's own words and only changed them when it better suited the format of a graphic novel

- "The economic and racial disparities, the blinders that "civilized" society stubbornly clings to, the realization that justice for all can never exist without equality for all—these are vividly portrayed not only via Lee's words but also by Fordham's art, making this graphic adaptation of To Kill a Mockingbird a worthy partner to the original, providing a clarion call for civility, equality, and justice for all." — New York Journal of Books

- "Gorgeously rendered." —USA Today

Professional reviewers noted it as "a perfect complement and homage to the novel, and much closer to the original manuscript than the classic film. It is in no way a replacement, but an adaptation that should make both English teachers and students very happy."

Educators particularly appreciated it, with teachers looking to support their ELL (English Language Learners) and Special Ed students, and one teacher noting "Wonderful addition to my curriculum towards To Kill A Mockingbird. I cannot tell you how many times I refer back to this while teaching."

## Sales Information

While specific sales figures weren't provided in the search results, there are several indicators of commercial success:

- The graphic novel was published in 2018 by Harper publication
- Multiple formats were released, including hardcover editions with ISBN 9780062798183 and 9781785151552
- The book appears to be widely available through major retailers including Amazon, where it has received numerous customer reviews
- It was voted the #1 Great American Read 2018

The graphic novel joined "the ranks of the graphic novel adaptations of A Wrinkle in Time and The Alchemist", suggesting it was positioned as a premium literary adaptation.

Overall, Fred Fordham's 2018 graphic novel adaptation of "To Kill a Mockingbird" was critically acclaimed for its faithful adaptation, beautiful illustrations, and effectiveness in making the classic story accessible to new audiences while respecting the source material.
